description.value: Profile on the Composition resource which represents the nursing handoff for adults (Overdrachtsbericht Volwassenen) for eOverdracht conform information standard ['Verpleegkundige zorg'](https://informatiestandaarden.nictiz.nl/wiki/Landingspagina_Verpleegkundige_Zorg)

purpose.value: The purpose of this nursing handoff is to enable the health organization that receives it to continue the care for patients/clients of 18 years and older.

short.value: Who or what initiated the nursing handoff

definition.value: The person that initiated the sending of the nursing handoff. Alternatively, this may be the sending XIS.
Section for administrative data, including date of transfer, contact person and payer details, and details of the sending and receiving organizations.
Captures the planned transfer date, which can change in the actual transfer phase.
Subsection listing personal data of the payer and contact persons that are legal representatives of the patient.

comment.value: Use only if the relatedPerson is a legal representative. Use the contact element in the Patient resource to define contactpersons whom are not legal representatives.

definition.value: Subsection listing data about the sending organization.

short.value: A reference to data about the sending organization

definition.value: Subsection listing data about the receiving organization.

short.value: A reference to data about the receiving organization

defaultValueString.value: Personal and social history section (record artifact)
Finding of characteristics of home environment (finding)

comment.value: Wensen en behoeften patiënt en/of naasten

This element can be used to communicate an unstructured care plan by setting `.section:carePlan:text.status` to _additional_. If the unstructured care plan is communicated, there should be no structred data in `.section:carePlan:.section`.

defaultValueString.value: Finding related to ability to perform personal care activity (finding)
bevinding betreffende vermogen tot grove motoriek (bevinding)

comment.value: Note: this profile is to be used together with the zib-Wound and zib-PressureUlcer profiles.
